controller

Class AbstractCharacterController<T extends Character>

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.AbstractCharacterController<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of mover you are wanting to move... it must extend Mover in the model.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameController, MoverController<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlayerController, SuperZombieController, ZombieController

    public abstract class AbstractCharacterController<T extends Character>
extends java.lang.Object
implements MoverController<T>
    This class does most of the work for setting the character speed and rotation

      If 'R' is pressed, player's speed is updated to 2.0, making them two times faster.
      void stopMoving()
      If two incompatible directions are pressed; or stop moving the character
      void walk()
      When 'R' is released, player's speed drops back down to 1.0, the default speed.
